Super fun cooperative game, the only co-op game I think is better than this one is Left 4 Dead 2.

Overall, I'd give this game an 8.5/10

As someone that grew up playing Xbox, this series was one of my favorites that I've played since it came out. Since I've switched to pc, it was one of the first few games that I bought so I could get accustomed to mouse and keyboard. For new pc players it's a good starting point.

It's a classic and stands up to the test of time. There are still a few people playing and it's a good community.

I had trouble with my mouse on Mac, what worked for me was to alt+tab to another screen, click and move the mouse, then return to the game.

Es un buen juego, no es un survival horror como tal pero es divertido, eso sí, jugalo con amigos porque los servidores son re toxicos xd. Ta muy weno, compralo :D

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

I'm old and loved this first time round, and now finding myself with a low spec PC after literally decades of just playing on console, I think this is one of the best shooters still to this day. The atmosphere is amazing. That and the simplicity edges this over part two for me. LFD1 vs 2 is basically Terminator vs Judgement Day; More mood, or more action. Both are incredible though.

Yes, the sequel has the same content and more, but there's something about the original Left 4 Dead. Maybe it's the grittier art style, or the more balanced gameplay because less content means less balancing and a more polished game as a result. There's a sense of minimalism and aesthetics to both the graphics and the gameplay.

It's worth noting that, while the L4D1 maps were ported to L4D2, they weren't rebalanced for the new special infected - mainly the Charger and Jockey - which can lead to some rather cheap deaths. If I'm playing a L4D1 campaign, I'd rather do it in the game that the campaign was balanced for, and that's when L4D1 becomes a viable purchase.

"The Director", L4D's invisible AI that changes maps up depending on how you're playing, is way ahead of its time and somehow keeps the same maps from becoming repetitive. It will reward you for good plays as well as punish you for being dumb. Although I'd only call it a horror game at a stretch, you almost never know what's going to be around that corner. The dynamic shadows and lighting are some of the best that Source can provide and are genuinely pretty at times.

L4D2 is the better game for sure, but L4D2 and zombie fans in general looking to shake things up a bit might find something here. Obviously it's better with friends, but solo play is pretty fun if you just want to shoot shit without thinking too much, partly because you have less to think about than in L4D2. Going solo also means that you'll have time to take in the lore, which in classic old Valve style is delivered via showing and not telling, and is often ambiguous. 

The shotguns are slightly OP compared to the sequel, but I have no issue with that at all because shotguns.

Oh My God! Does this company ever make a BAD game??? They are up there with Bethesda in my books mate. I love the stuff that is made on the Steam software too, like EYE divine Cybermancy. It rivals Unity and is a lot more 'Everyman PC Specs' friendly. Left 4 dead, why did I wait so long? Was going to jump straight to number 2, glad i didn't. Want to play both of them, I mean what is Lord of the rings two without seeing the first one? Its good, but after seeing one first, TWO is much better. Understand? Anyway i'm rambling guys. This game is awesome. Can't wait to see what Valve makes available to me and my humble little PC that could, next...
fun game to pass the time.

I've put countless hours of my time into the Left 4 Dead series over the past decade, and I will always love it. People act like games get outdated.. truth is, I feel sorry for those people. I think I really do. Games like this and Ocarina of Time, FFVII, The Legend Of Dragoon, every Resident Evil game, Brute Force, XIII, Darkwatch, classic Halos, Diablo 1 & 2, Fallout New Vegas, etc. All great games, and they ALWAYS will be, no matter how old.
absolute brilliant game,highly recommended to any new or old players

9.9/10

after playing L4D2, I thought what L4D1 would be like, the game is very good like L4D2, so after playing, my conclusion is:

- L4D1 has achievements that L4D2 doesn't have
-  if you already have L4D2, buy in a promotion, it is not worth buying at the original price
- everything L4D1 has, L4D2 has better :0
- doesn't have: Charger, Jockey, Spitter, Mudmen, Riot, Clown, Workers...
- doesn't have: Melee weapons, Magnum, AK-47, Granate Launcher, Machine Gun...
- people keep playing versus mode, (not like L4D2 but still) and I thought I wouldn't find any lobby :P
- no workshop D:
- L4D1 is more dark than L4D2
- if you played L4D2 before L4D1 like me, you will probably miss some things like I said
- The ending is sad  :(
